messages.content: Generating mitigation language to address the identified risk factors (broad 30‑day notice period and lack of immediate notice).

arguments.clause_text: The Supplier shall notify the Customer of any data breach affecting Personal Data within thirty (30) days after the Supplier becomes aware of such breach.
arguments.risk_factors: 30‑day notification period may be considered excessive delay; no provision for immediate notice when breach impacts critical systems.

messages.content: {"revised_clause": "The Supplier shall provide immediate written notice to the Customer upon becoming aware of any data breach affecting Personal Data, and shall thereafter furnish a detailed report within fifteen (15) business days."}
Compiling a full risk analysis report for the contract...

The data‑breach notification clause currently carries a risk score of **78/100**, indicating a relatively high exposure due to the 30‑day notice window. Based on five comparable California cases—two of which resulted in significant damages—the platform recommends the following revised language to lower risk:

> **Revised Clause:** "The Supplier shall provide immediate written notice to the Customer upon becoming aware of any data breach affecting Personal Data, and shall thereafter furnish a detailed report within fifteen (15) business days."

This tighter timeline aligns with recent case law and reduces potential liability. You can review the complete analysis, case references, and additional recommendations in the generated report: https://lexriskscorer.com/reports/contract_9876_report.pdf
